result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew S Waddell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: to defendant re: payment of atty fees.
Order for Payment of Services and Expenses in case nos:  15 CF 59 and 15 CF 77 per statement submitted by Atty Green
Filed By Atty Karl Green

Defendant Matthew S. Waddell in court with attorney Karl Green. Crystal N. Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to counts 2&4 in 15CF59. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence withheld, 2 yr. probation, 20 days jail on count 2, start August 30, 2015 at 7 p.m, may transfer to Dane Cty. Jail on electronic monitoring, $543 costs. On ct. 4,  2 yr. probation, $343 costs, on both: Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations.   Maintain absolute sobriety. Complete domestic violence counseling. Periodic review to be done in six months.  Any other counseling agent deems appropriate. Remaining counts read in and dismissed. No jail credit. In 15CF77, Defendant plead no contest to counts 1&2. Court found guilty, withheld sentence, 2 yrs. probation, on ct. 1, submit DNA sample, $518 costs, bond applied. On ct. 2, $268 costs. Same conds. as in 15CF59 (minus the jail) Court granted 3 days jail credit. Count 3 read in and dismissed.

Cases called:  15CF59 & 15CF77, Defendant Matthew S Waddell in court with attorney Karl A Green.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed in 15CF77. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.   Information filed, reading waived.

for contact. DA objected.

Defendant continued to waive time limits.  Preliminary hearing requested by Atty Green.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 25, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Court called 8:19am, court adjourned 8:22am. Defendant, Matthew S Waddell, appeared on both 15CF59 and 15CF77. Court finds def indigent and appoints Atty Karl Green. Def to pay $300 by May 15, 2015 and $100 thereafter.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 10:00 am.  Return date scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
Indigency hearing on April 20, 2015 at 08:15 am.
